data.title: HAYLEY MARIE NORMAN Interview at "Forks Over Knives" Premier
data.description:

HAYLEY MARIE NORMAN (Dorfman, Nephilim, Fired Up!, CSI: Miami, CSI: N.Y.) at "Forks Over Knives" premiere red carpet arrivals at Pacific Design Center in Los Angel

asset.author: Vega
asset.hookText:
http://www.youtube.com/maximotv 
http://www.maximotv.com
Maximo TV - License this clip

HAYLEY MARIE NORMAN (Dorfman, Nephilim, Fired Up!, CSI: Miami, CSI: N.Y.) at "Forks Over Knives" premiere red carpet arrivals at Pacific Design Center in Los Angeles, California USA - Interview by Erica Rhodes 
The documentary film "Forks Over Knives" examines the profound claim that many of our most-debilitating degenerative diseases -- such as heart disease, type-2 diabetes, and several forms of cancer -- are almost always preventable, and in many cases reversible, through diet alone. The major storyline traces the journeys of Dr. T. Colin Campbell, a nutritional biochemist from Cornell University, and Dr. Caldwell Esselstyn, a former top surgeon at the Cleveland Clinic.  The idea of food as medicine is put to the test.  Throughout the film, cameras follow "reality patients" who have chronic conditions from heart disease to diabetes.  Doctors teach these patients how to adopt a whole foods plant-based diet as the primary approach to treat their ailments -- while the challenges and triumphs of their journeys are revealed.  Brian Wendel is the Creator and Executive Producer and Lee Fulkerson is the Writer and Director. For more information please go to www.forksoverknives.com. 

***This footage is available for licensing*** 
The viewing of this clip by website visitors is only permissible for personal use; copying, commercial use, distribution, broadcast, download, additional use or transfer is expressly prohibited. Disclaimer: I do receive the Eco Emi packages without charge, but honestly my opinions and thoughts of the individual products & service itself are not altered by that. If I don't get a good first impression, I will mention it. If I get a great first impression, I will let you know as well. If I had heard about them earlier, I would have signed up in a heart beat! I truly 100% believe in the service and completely recommend it !

asset.hookText:
http://fitfortwo.tv

Marta and Brock hit the streets of Toronto at "10,000 Tastes, 10 Billion Reasons", Vegan Festival. 
They interview NHL enforcer and vegan, Georges Laraque who discusses why he turned vegan and the benefits he experienced in doing so.
Brock and Marta also catch up with YouTube sensation, "Vegan Meal Time", who headlined the festival with a unique and entertaining performance in Yonge and Dundas Square.

Learn more about Georges Laraque: http://georgeslaraque.com

Learn more about Vegan Meal Time: http://youtube.com/gettingfriendly

Learn about the Festival: http://empathy-unlimited.org/10billionreasons

Follow us:
http://facebook.com/fitfortwotv
http://twitter.com/fitfortwo

data.title: Banana Bread Protein Bar by Lyzabeth Lopez
data.description:
Lyzabeth's Banana Bread Protein Bar

- 1 scoop of your favorite protein powder

- ½ cup puffed quinoa
- ½ cup ground walnuts
- ¼ cup dairy free chocolate chips

Mix all ingre

asset.author: Vega
asset.hookText:
Lyzabeth's Banana Bread Protein Bar

- 1 banana
- 1 cup dates
- 1 scoop of your favorite protein powder
- mini cup apple mango sauce
- ½ cup puffed quinoa
- ½ cup ground walnuts
- ¼ cup dairy free chocolate chips
- 2 tsp cinnamon
- ½ nutmeg

Mix all ingredients in food processor.
Place on wax paper.
Roll it with rolling pin.
Roll into balls or cut into squares.
Enjoy!

Lyzabeth's Beauty Shake

All other ingredients and blend.

data.title: Lyzabeth's 'Raw Power Balls' BODY FUEL TV
data.description:
Lyzabeth's Power Balls


1 cup gogi berries 
2 cups pumpkin seeds 
1/2 cup cacao nibs 
1 tsp mesquite powder 
¼ cup almond butter
(optional) 
1 tbs cinnamon 
¼ cup agave nectar 
¼ cup of chia seeds 


Using a food processor, pulse pumpkin seeds until fine

asset.author: Vega
asset.hookText:
Lyzabeth's Power Balls


1 cup gogi berries 
2 cups pumpkin seeds 
1/2 cup cacao nibs 
1 tsp mesquite powder 
¼ cup almond butter
(optional) 
1 tbs cinnamon 
¼ cup agave nectar 
¼ cup of chia seeds 


Using a food processor, pulse pumpkin seeds until finely chopped. Do not over blend. The seeds should have some texture. 
Place seeds in a bowl with remaining ingredients and mix thoroughly. 
Note: It is very important to keep kneading the dough in order to form truffles so they will stick. 
Yields about 20 truffles. Last for a long time stored in a refrigerator. 
Suggestion: Use other nuts or seeds or fruit to form your truffles. Roll in coconut, bee pollen or other favorites for alternatives.
